title: Your Thursday Briefing
text:
After years of economic stagnation, Russians’ patience with their government is wearing thin. Aleksandr Gabyshev, above, is a shaman who tapped into that frustration, helping to prompt widespread protests in one of Siberia’s biggest cities.

Mr. Gabyshev, who says President Vladimir Putin of Russia requires an exorcism, has been detained and faces incarceration in a mental institution. “My tales coincided with the desperation of Russians who live with injustice, poverty and destitution,” he said.

Here’s what else is happening

2020 campaign: Joe Biden said President Trump should be impeached, moving past his position of supporting a congressional inquiry but not full impeachment. “Donald Trump has violated his oath of office, betrayed this nation and committed impeachable acts,” Mr. Biden, a Democratic presidential candidate, said.

Huawei: In language that appeared to point to but did not name the Chinese giant, a European Union report warned that a 5G supplier from a “hostile” country could be forced by its home government to wreak havoc by causing cyberattacks. Huawei was blacklisted by the U.S. after the White House labeled it a tool for espionage by Beijing.

California: The state’s largest utility cut power to 500,000 customers, fearing high winds that could down power lines and set off wildfires. The company, Pacific Gas & Electric, has been found responsible for dozens of such fires in recent years.

Nobel Prize in Chemistry: The ubiquitous lithium-ion battery, which revolutionized portable electronics, electric cars and lifesaving medical devices, emerged from the work of three scientists starting in the 1970s. The trio won this year’s Nobel Prize in Chemistry for research that “laid the foundation of a wireless, fossil fuel-free society.”

Nobel Prize in Literature: The Nobel Prize in Literature for 2018 will be awarded today, along with this year’s. The prize wasn’t given out last year because of a sex-abuse scandal involving the group that chooses the winner.
description: A gunman livestreamed an attack in Germany.
